Identity.title: identity.md
Identity.bio: I build digital products with an architectural mindset. My goal is to transform complex problems into high-performance, maintainable web systems.

Stack.title: Capabilities.json
Stack.tech_1_desc: Proficiency in TypeScript and React for building reactive, type-safe interfaces.
Stack.tech_2_desc: Experience with Next.js (App Router), Node.js, and data modeling with MongoDB.
Stack.tech_3_desc: Advanced use of LLMs to accelerate development and automate complex workflows.
Stack.soft_1_desc: Advanced proficiency for technical reading and direct collaboration within global teams.
Stack.soft_2_desc: I believe software is a team sport. I prioritize radical clarity and proactivity to prevent communication bottlenecks.
Stack.soft_3_desc: I actively apply principles of 'How to Win Friends and Influence People' to foster cooperation and win-win negotiations.

growmoney.hero_desc: A platform designed to democratize financial education. Content creation with layered data modeling and side-by-side versioning.
growmoney.s1_body: I designed the schema to mirror the complexity of a formal curriculum. Data is organized into a four-tier nested structure, enabling high reusability of lessons, concepts, and modules across different financial journeys.
growmoney.s2_body_1: To ensure production stability, I implemented a Side-by-Side Versioning system. Edits to published content do not overwrite the live version; instead, they are captured in a
growmoney.s2_guard_body: Recursive governance checks prevent an administrator from publishing a Journey if any underlying Module or Lesson remains in a Draft state.
growmoney.s3_body: The platform recognizes that financial education is context-dependent. I developed a Universal-to-Regional Transition pattern where the system identifies a user's locale and dynamically injects regional sub-lessons.
growmoney.s3_logic_body: By resolving these dependencies at the database level using Aggregation Pipelines, I minimized API payload sizes and avoided the overhead of client-side content swapping.

gallery.item_1_desc: Content consumption interface focused on readability and retention, featuring lateral navigation through the journey structure.
gallery.item_2_desc: Administrative panel for status and version management of modules, ensuring integrity before publication.
gallery.item_3_desc: Editing canvas where concepts and lessons are organized in a modular and scalable manner.
gallery.item_4_desc: Creation environment with support for dynamic regionalization and structured data export tools.

growmoney.note: GrowMoney was my first deep dive into system design. It took months of iterating and refactoring to reach the current state. The content hierarchy—lessons, concepts, modules, journeys—was completely redesigned three times. Versioning also presented a significant challenge, involving strict rules for posting, editing, and deleting content. Future steps for GrowMoney include a more streamlined content creation flow and deeper financial curriculum content.

repocontext.hero_desc: A high-performance codebase ingestion engine designed to transform local repositories into LLM-optimized context.
repocontext.s1_body: To handle large codebases without UI lag, I moved the exclusion logic directly into the Recursive Scanner. By validating .gitignore and custom rules before reading, the engine avoids unnecessary processing overhead.
repocontext.s2_body: Processing 5,000+ file handles simultaneously can crash the browser heap. I implemented a Batching Engine that limits execution to 25 files per pass.
repocontext.s2_box_body: This ensured 100% stability, preventing the system from freezing in a 'Parsing' state during extensive parallel executions.
repocontext.s3_box_1_body: The 5.6MB GPT-4 dictionary is dynamically imported only when required. This reduced the initial JS payload by 85%, ensuring a sub-second Time-to-Interactive.
repocontext.s3_box_2_body: Implemented a strict Content Security Policy. I balanced security with framework hydration to achieve a 100/100 Lighthouse score.
repocontext.note: RepoContext was a fascinating performance study. I learned that speed isn't just about code—it's about managing browser resources. Moving from unbound parallel execution to a batching model taught me how to build software that is robust enough for real-world production constraints. Plus, the UI turned out great and has been extremely useful!

Roadmap.title: Technical Roadmap
Roadmap.subtitle: Strategic planning for the next steps of my career. Focused on building a solid foundation and initiating a journey of continuous development.
Roadmap.footer_tag: Goal: Achieve seniority through continuous iteration and learning

stages.s1_d: IT Technician certification. Core focus on Web Development, Databases, Design, and Computer Networking.
stages.s2_d: Deep dive into data modeling, versioning, and state management. This project cemented the importance of system architecture.
stages.s3_d: Intensive study of JS, TS, React, and Next.js via industry-leading courses to bridge the gap to enterprise-level production.
stages.s4_d: Securing a Software Engineering role to apply architectural knowledge within a real-world team and production codebase.

steps.s1_body: I designed this space for you to explore my work as if you were in my own code editor. Note: The 'identity.md' file is your 30-second hub with everything you need.
steps.s2_body: Navigate through folders to see the technical specifications of my projects, education, and roadmap.
steps.s3_body: Feel at home. You can open multiple files at once and switch between them using these tabs.
steps.s4_body: Looking for something specific? Use the search icon or press 'Ctrl + K' to open the command palette.
steps.s5_body: The console is yours. Change themes, languages, or interface density here.
steps.s6_body: If you like what you see, download my CV here or send me a message via 'contacts.ts'. Shall we build something together?
